Name: Morning Star: Those Who Remain in the Night Part II
Description: Luther makes a surprise visit to the Old District and seems to be after someone. You soon realize who that someone is…
QuestDesc: Luther makes a surprise visit to the Old District and seems to be after someone. You soon realize who that someone is…

Conditions.PreQuestName: Morning Star: Those Who Remain in the Night Part I

Dialogues.Speaker: Luther
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your support, {PlayerName}. With your help, the recovery work here has progressed much faster than expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luther
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe may still have a ways to go before she shoulders everything on her own, but with your help and the combined efforts of other Acolytes, I believe everything will work out smoothly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luther
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many migrants from Ragunna aren't too happy to see me, so I'll keep it short.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luther
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you seen...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that Priest Alessio? What are you doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's on your mind?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to know your thoughts on Lady Julia and Acolyte Luther.

Options.PlotLineKey: About why Julia doesn't deserve to die, and Luther shouldn't be tried now?
About why Julia doesn't deserve to die, and Luther should stand trial?
About why Julia deserves to die, and Luther shouldn't be tried now?
About why Julia deserves to die, and Luther should stand trial?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I've come to see you as a truly kind and brave individual.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over the past few days, I've come to realize that it takes courage to face who you are… and just as much to forgive someone else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Julia and Acolyte Luther ultimately chose to take responsibility for their mistakes. Regardless of who they were in the past, both of them stood with courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is why I must find my own courage and give something back to this world that has shown me such grace. This is my path of Ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It makes me wonder why you made these separate judgments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps for Lady Julia, exile was too harsh. She's shown the will to change, but wasn't given a chance to redeem herself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It reminds me that I shouldn't take the compassion this world's shown me for granted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is why I must find my own courage and give something back to this world that has shown me such grace. This is my path of Ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It makes me wonder why you made these separate judgments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps for Acolyte Luther, helping to guide the Order forward should be his priority. However, we have no right to stand and judge the victims of this disaster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And maybe, beyond courage, Acolyte Luther also holds faith that the people of Ragunna will make the right judgment. That's why he stepped forward to face trial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is why I must find my own courage and give something back to this world that has shown me such grace. This is my path of Ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I've come to see you as kind, but also unwavering in your principles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Julia and Acolyte Luther ultimately chose to take responsibility for their mistakes. Both brave people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They both deserve a fair trial. That is the truest form of respect we can offer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is why I must find my own courage and give something back to this world that has shown me such grace. This is my path of Ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of Ascension, I didn't expect Phoebe to be given so much light. She's even being promoted to the Privy Council.

Options.PlotLineKey: You'll have to call her Priest Phoebe next time you two meet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, the Phoebe I know wouldn't care about such things!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, I've long stopped caring about such things!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw the burden she's had to carry before coming to Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I believe in Phoebe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's a lot tougher than her appearance would lead you to believe. Although she does seem the type that struggles to say no to people, she's never lost her sense of direction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If she stepped into the Privy Council under Acolyte Luther's guidance, then I'm sure she has the resolve to live up to what's expected of her. That's her path of Ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, it's a lot to place on her shoulders. I should do something to help her, and I'll start by doing my part in rebuilding the Old District!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Acolyte Luther has always cared deeply for the lower-ranking Acolytes. He's been a mediating force among the noble families, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was unexpected to see him being sent to trial like this.

Options.PlotLineKey: He shouldn't be tried, at least not now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Neither of us has the right to decide whether to judge him on behalf of the victims.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he is truly innocent, then all the more reason he should be standing trial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then should I...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alessio will be the spark that ignites the Ragunnesi's rage. Meanwhile, the one who could calm the flames is already behind bars.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who then will stop this rage from burning the innocent?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How exactly do we define "innocent"...?
